main event: A witness observed a bright, shiny object in the sky in Columbus, Ohio on September 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object was brighter than a star and moved faster than a star, The object was stationary at times and then suddenly disappeared to the west, The sighting lasted for 15 minutes, The witness described the object as bluish-white and larger than a star, The report concluded that the object was unidentified according to the observer.
sighted object: a bright shiny object in the sky
